name: Muslim American Youth Foundation
mission: Our mission is to educate and instil a drive for personal academic success, enrich through experience and expansion of what is really possible, and enlighten by means of taking the aforementioned experiences and incorporating them into their personal lives, households and communities.
theoryOfChange: Educate, Enrich, and Enlighten: providing culturally relevant and spiritually grounded programs (inputs) to strengthen identity and values (outputs) to enable youth to lead and uplift communities (outcomes).
zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.evidence: Niche cause: UNKNOWN (+4); Serves underserved populations (+3)
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 33/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Youth Foundation shows good alignment and good impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The official website and descriptions of Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) programs do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or zakat campaigns. The organization focuses on empowering and uplifting Muslim-American youth and their communities through educational, sports, faith, health advocacy, and social justice programs.

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a 72.1% program expense ratio and holds 13.4 months of working capital.
The foundation recorded total revenue of $1,734,105 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.03 per $1 raised.
The mission of the foundation is to create and operate a facility for youth education, enrichment, and enlightenment.
Donation options are available for supporters to contribute via sadaqah-eligible giving methods.
The foundation offers engagement opportunities through volunteer programs for community members.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate score of 62/100, reflecting solid financial efficiency and liquidity balanced against a lack of external performance ratings and limited data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public data regarding specific program outcomes and long-term impact metrics
Lower data confidence due to a lack of third-party evaluations or comprehensive reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 33/50, the charity offers a medium fit for donors interested in domestic poverty and youth enrichment [3]. The foundation provides clear pathways for community involvement through volunteer opportunities and sadaqah-eligible donations, though its track record is primarily documented through self-reported financial filings [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to capacity building by allocating a 72.1% program expense ratio toward its facility and youth services [1][2]. While financial health is stable with 13.4 months of working capital, the overall impact score of 30/50 is limited by a lack of third-party verification regarding specific beneficiary outcomes [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim American Youth Foundation provides a dedicated facility for the education, enrichment, and athletic development of youth within the community.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.03 per $1 raised
Strong short-term liquidity with 13.4 months of working capital available
Direct focus on domestic youth development and mentoring programs
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim American Youth Foundation (MAYF) operates as a community-focused organization dedicated to creating a facility for youth education, enlightenment, and mentoring [1][3]. With a total revenue of $1,734,105, the foundation manages diverse programming including community services and youth sports to foster local engagement [2]. Supporters can contribute to these efforts through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods [4].
